instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a liquid damage logic board. One of the RAM chips was badly corroded so I reballed it. The macbook will boot and pass ASD EFI but if I try to boot any OS, either ASD or a USB test drive it just cuts out. Any ideas where to start?

Cheers,

Alex

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
threads.message: I had a hard time finding one for this model. Found one on the internet and flashed it, same issue remains. I can't be sure this is a good BIOS image though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
threads.message: If ME region cause this, you get nothing trying Internet dump read from other machine...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
threads.message: I don't have a donor board for this model. Are you saying that you think the ME region may be what is causing this behaviour? If so, I could clean the ME region.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
threads.message:
Looks like ME issue.

I don't remember where I got them from.
No idea if are really clean even; just for try...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1zdmJoFVCvNMjuWG0JsaxH4NmDw0SvZ-Y[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
threads.message:
Cheers, I'll give them a try.

I just tried one that Duke uploaded in this thread: [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/4153-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-bios[/url]
He forgot to clear the password but the ME region was clean. I removed the password and I still have the same issue. But I'll try the ones you linked to.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cuts out booting from ASD OS but runs fine from ASD EFI
threads.message: Turned out to be the trackpad. Cleaned up some corrosion on the keyboard connector and reflashed the original EFI back and it's now booting up just fine. ASD passes. Thanks for your help anyway.
